title: Conductors - charges on spheres after contact

content.description: Two conducting spheres, <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, are attached to nonconducting stands. Sphere <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi> </math> has a radius of <math alttext="0.3 meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> and Sphere <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has a radius of <math alttext="0.1 meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. Both spheres initially have net charges of <math alttext="positive 10 nanocoulombs" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nC</mi></math>. The spheres are brought into contact with one another, and then separated and moved far away from each other.
